messages.content:
Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_low = vlogic_high; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
V(vout_qbar) <+ transition( vlogic_high*q + vlogic_low*!q, Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
V(vout_qbar) <+ transition( vlogic_high*!q + vlogic_low*q,

 Correction Criteria：The qbar output incorrectly uses the same expression as the q output, making both outputs identical instead of complementary. This violates the fundamental flip-flop behavior where qbar must be the logical inverse of q.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   tdel, tfall, trise); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
V(vout_q) <+ transition( vlogic_high*!q + vlogic_low*q, Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
V(vout_q) <+ transition( vlogic_high*q + vlogic_low*!q,

 Correction Criteria：The expression incorrectly uses !q instead of q for vlogic_high, causing vout_q to output the complement of the intended value. This inverts the flip-flop's Q output while leaving Qbar unchanged, violating the truth table where Q and Qbar must be complementary.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vtrans = -1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_high = vlogic_low; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module jk_clk_ff(vin_j, vin_k, vout_q, vclk, vout_qbar); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      V(vout_q) <+ transition( vlogic_high*!q + vlogic_low*q, Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      V(vout_q) <+ transition( vlogic_high*q + vlogic_low*!q,

 Correction Criteria：The expression incorrectly uses !q instead of q for the high logic value and q instead of !q for the low logic value. This inverts the output signal vout_q relative to the internal state q, causing vout_q to always be the complement of what it should be.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real trise = -1u; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input vin_j, vclk, vin_k; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   tdel, trise, 2*tfall); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_low = vlogic_high; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_high = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross( V(vclk) - vtrans_clk, 0 )) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
@ (cross( V(vclk) - vtrans_clk, +1 )) begin

 Correction Criteria：Changed cross direction from rising edge (+1) to any edge (0), causing the flip-flop to trigger on both rising AND falling clock edges instead of only rising edges as specified in the design description.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   real q = 0.5; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module jk_clk_ff(vin_j, vin_k, vclk, vout_qbar, vout_q); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
end else if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_j) < vtrans) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
end else if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) < vtrans) begin

 Correction Criteria：Changed condition to check vin_j against vtrans in both directions instead of vin_j and vin_k. This creates an impossible condition (voltage cannot be simultaneously above and below threshold), preventing the set operation (J=1, K=0) from ever triggering.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_low = vlogic_high; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_high = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input vout_q, output vout_qbar; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module jk_clk_ff(vin_j, vin_k vclk, vout_q, vout_qbar); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            q = !q Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real tdel = 3u from [0:inf) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            q = !q Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            q = !q Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
         if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans) begin

 Correction Criteria：Missing closing parenthesis ')' for the conditional expression in the if statement

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            q = 0 +; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
            q = !q Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vlogic_low = 0 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer q Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   analog begin // Missing semicolon after 'analog Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog begin

 Correction Criteria：Missing semicolon after 'analog' keyword before 'begin' block

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real vtrans_clk = 2.5 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module jk_clk_ff(vin_j; vin_k, vclk, vout_q, vout_qbar); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         endd else if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) < vtrans) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
         end else if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) < vtrans) begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled keyword 'end' as 'endd' - 'endd' is not a valid Verilog-A keyword and will cause a syntax error

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
         if (V(vin_j) > vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans) begin

 Correction Criteria：Missing closing parenthesis ')' for the conditional expression in the if statement. The condition is not properly terminated, causing a syntax error due to unbalanced parentheses.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
(* instrument_module; *) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
(* instrument_module *)

 Correction Criteria：Semicolon inside attribute comment is invalid syntax as attributes cannot contain statement terminators

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real tdel = 3u from [0:inf) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         end else if (V(vin_j) < vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
         end else if (V(vin_j) < vtrans && V(vin_k) > vtrans) begin

 Correction Criteria：Missing closing parenthesis for the conditional expression in the else if statement, causing unbalanced parentheses and invalid syntax.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
           analog begn Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
           analog begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled 'begin' keyword as 'begn

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   intege q; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.
